isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS

svcsubsecinfo.para: Proper adjustments are critical to the cab structure, as this will affect the functioning of other components of the vehicle. The following adjustments must be performed in the order listed below. Before adjusting the hood or squaring the cab, refer to the CAB segment on mounting for the proper cab installation.

svcproc.title: CAB SQUARING
svcproc.para: Cab squaring is the centering and perpendicular positioning of the cab structure to the frame. The cab must be squared whenever the cab has been removed from the chassis for repair, or if a new cab is being mounted.

The cab must be properly squared to the frame as this adjustment will affect the relationship between the cab, hood and sleeper box. Improper squaring may result in unacceptable appearance and interference between the above units. Be sure the chassis is on a level surface before squaring.
Refer to Figure 109 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Center the cab (Item 1) on the frame rail (Item 4) by using the dimension (Item A) from the cab cowl (Item 5) to the frame rail.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Adjust the cab to make the cowl and the back panel parallel and perpendicular to the frame. Add or remove shims (Item 2) between the crossmember (Item 3) and the cab lower rear mounting bracket (Item 1).
